title: Taiping District, Taichung
text:
Taiping District () is an inner city <a href="District%20%28Taiwan%29">district</a> in the eastern part of <a href="Taichung">Taichung</a>, <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>. It is the second largest district in Taichung City after <a href="Heping%20District%2C%20Taichung">Heping District</a>.
History.
After the <a href="Retrocession%20Day">handover of Taiwan from Japan</a> to the <a href="Republic%20of%20China%20%281912%E2%80%931949%29">Republic of China</a> in 1945, Taiping was organized as a <a href="Township%20%28Taiwan%29">rural township</a> of <a href="Taichung%20County">Taichung County</a>. On 1 August 1996, Taiping was upgraded to a <a href="county-administered%20city">county-administered city</a> due to its population. On 25 December 2010, Taichung County was merged with Taichung City and Taiping was upgraded to a <a href="District%20%28Taiwan%29">district</a> of the <a href="Special%20municipality%20%28Taiwan%29">city</a>.
Administrative divisions.
Taiping District consists of 39 villages, which are Taiping, Zhangyi, Yongcheng, Zhongping, Zhongzheng, Pingan, Zhongxing, Yongping, Tungping, Chenggong, Tunghe, Jianguo, Jianxing, Pinglin, Daxing, Qinyi, Guanghua, Guangming, Zhongshan, Fengnian, Yixin, Yijia, Yichang, Xinping, Xinji, Xincheng, Xinguang, Xinxing, Xingao, Xinfu, Toubian, Shenghe, Tungbian, Xinglong, Fulong, Huangzhu, Guanglong, Yonglong and Delong Village.
Economy.
Taiping District supplies many agricultural products to the <a href="Taichung">Taichung</a> urban area, including
<a href="loquat">loquat</a>s, <a href="longan">longan</a>s, <a href="banana">banana</a>s, and <a href="vegetable">vegetable</a>s.
Sister cities.
<a href="Lincoln%2C%20Nebraska">Lincoln, Nebraska</a> is Taiping's <a href="sister%20city">sister city</a>.<a href="http%3A//www.taiping.gov.tw/english/pbt05.htm"></a>
